COMMENT: India's largest inland salt lake; produces ~9% of India's salt.
Also known as Dhebar Lake; second largest artificial lake in Asia when built.
Famous for Nau Chauki (9 pavilions) and the world's largest stone inscription.
An iconic artificial lake in Udaipur; houses the Lake Palace (Jag Niwas).
A sacred Hindu lake in Ajmer with 52 ghats; host of the famous Camel Fair.
Connected to Pichola Lake; houses an island solar observatory.
Artificial lake in Ajmer built by Arnoraja; features Baradari marble pavilions.
Located at Mount Abu; mythological belief that it was dug out by gods' nails.
Important source of industrial sodium sulfate.
Located in Barmer; produces salt with 98% sodium chloride purity.
Built by Maharana Udai Singh; part of the Berach River system.
A man-made lake near Jodhpur serving as the primary drinking water source.
Historic lake in Jodhpur surrounded by lush gardens and a summer palace.
A rainwater conservation lake in Jaisalmer surrounded by shrines and ghats.
A smaller saltwater lake located in the Bikaner district.
A beautiful lake in Alwar; often called the Nandan Kanan of Rajasthan.
